Hi everyone. I plan to bring some MYR in my Maybank Malaysia account back to Singapore account ie in SGD. What's the most cost effective way to do this conversion and remittance? I do have a Maybank Singapore account. Soneone told me to use Wise but I'm not sure how this works.TIA
Are you Singaporean or Malaysian? Depending on your nationality it will affect which services you can use
Just like TikTok CEO  I'm a Singaporean
cimb my to cimb sg should work
My friend also suggested this but I don't have any CIMB account unfortunately
you can apply for both CIMB FastSavers SGD acc and CIMB AirAsia MYR acc at CIMB Raffles Place branch
then transfer your money from Maybank > CIMB MY > CIMB SG > Your local bank acc

there are 4 platforms to tt money from malaysia instarem wise sunwaymoney and moneymatch. so far the cheapest rate is sunwaymoney and moneymatch. the rates are even more favourable than exchanging using cimb sg. suggest you open account with sunwaymoney as it is part of sunway group. all platforms hv bank negara license. if you have domestic MYR borrowings(more than 1 CC  housing loan and carloan) you can only transfer up to max of RM1million in aggregate per year
